member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or null to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new string[] {"/dir/file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new object[] {"/dir/file1", fileInfo2, dirInfo1 }...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or null to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list must comprise file paths in and/or instances. (e.g. string[] files = new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" } or object[] files = new string[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 })
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files in the specified list to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The list of files and directories to upload. This list can contain and objects (e.g. UploadFiles(new string[] {"c:\data\file1", "c:\text\doc.txt", "c:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...)). This cannot be null or empty.
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory for storing files.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory that match the specified search condition to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition is the combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The search conditions to match against the files. (null for searching all files).

Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

For example: UploadFiles("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions)
member.summary: Uploads local files or directories in the list to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The list of files and directories to upload. This list can contain and objects (e.g. UploadFiles(new string[] {"c:\data\file1", "c:\text\doc.txt", "c:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFiles(new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...)). This cannot be null or empty.
The path of the remote directory to store the uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.

member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and parameters of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.UploadFilesAsync(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system that match the search condition specified in the option parameter to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new string[] {@"/file1", @"/folder/file2", @"dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new object[] {@"/temp/file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.ReconnectionMaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 0 (the library does not try to reconnect to the server when the connection is lost). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed this value, the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.ReconnectionFailureDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds between failed login attempts for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 5000 (5 secs). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed the , the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.ComponentPro#IO#IRemoteFileSystem#PathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to normalize path before any file or directory operation. Default value is true.
member.remarks: Set this to false if an operation fails due to the invalid normalized path or file path should be sent to the server as-is without adding the current directory to the beginning of the file path.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.ReconnectionErrorChecking
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server.
member.remarks: This event is fired when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server or the method is called.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.Reconnecting
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and trying to reconnect to the server.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.Reconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the file system encountered an error and reconnected to the server.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.EncounteredFatalError
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the client object has encountered a fatal error.
member.value: true if the client has tried and failed to reconnect to the server with the number of retries specified in ; otherwise false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an SCP operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout. Specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.State

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .
member.value: The that the component is using for communications.
member.remarks: The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your Socket is bound. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the property to retrieve the local , and the property to retrieve the local port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Scp.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .
member.value: The with which the Socket is communicating.
member.remarks: If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the property gets the that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the Socket is connected. If you are using a connectionless protocol, RemoteEndPoint contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the Socket will communicate. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the property to retrieve the remote , and the property to retrieve the remote port number.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.DownloadFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads files from the specified remote directory to the destination directory on the destination file system using multiple threads.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the destination folder. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

The list of files and directories to download, or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. DownloadFiles("", false, new string[] {"/dir/file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or DownloadFiles("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...))

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: DownloadFiles("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, zipSystem, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFiles(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFiles(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or null to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new string[] {"/dir/file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or UploadFiles(zipSystem, "", false, new object[] {"/dir/file1", fileInfo2, dirInfo1 }...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
The number of threads used for the file transfer.

A boolean value indicating whether to wait for the completion of all threads. If this parameter is true, this method will block the caller process's execution until all threads have completed; otherwise, this method will immediately return the control to the caller process.
member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory using multiple threads.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFiles(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition)
member.summary: Uploads files from the specified local directory that match the specified search condition to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition is the combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

member.returns: A object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and parameters of the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new string[] {@"d:\file1", @"c:\folder\file2", @"d:\dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(null, false, new object[] {@"d:\temp\file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition is the combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameter. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be uploaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be uploaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The search conditions to match against the files. (null for searching all files).
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFilesAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,ComponentPro.IO.FileExistsAction,ComponentPro.IO.SymlinksResolveAction,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads all files from the specified local directory to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The path and name of the local directory where the files will be uploaded to the server. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "c:\mydir\*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "c:\mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync("MyDir/*.txt", true, "/RemoteDir", true) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
Indicates whether all files and subdirectories will be transferred.
Specifies the action taken on existing files.
Specifies the action taken on symlinks.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.UploadFilesAsync(ComponentPro.IO.FileSystem,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.TransferOptions,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously uploads files from the specified source directory on the specified source file system that match the search condition specified in the option parameter to the specified remote directory.
member.param: The source file system containing files to upload.

The path and name of the directory on the source file system where the files will be uploaded to the server. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are uploaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be uploaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be uploaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be uploaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the local directory should be uploaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: UploadFilesAsync(zipSystem, "MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/RemoteDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "RemoteDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "RemoteDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "RemoteDir".

The list of files and directories to upload, or a null reference to upload files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This can contain and objects. (e.g. UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new string[] {@"/file1", @"/folder/file2", @"dir1" }, ...) or UploadFilesAsync(zipFileSystem, "", false, new object[] {@"/temp/file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }, ...))
The path of the remote directory to store uploaded files.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.summary: Asynchronously downloads files from the specified remote directory to the specified destination local directory.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the local folder. When the parameter is null reference, this parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition depends on the and settings of the parameter. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!

Indicates whether the containing directory should also be created in the destination directory. For example: DownloadFiles("/MyDir/*.txt", true, null, "/ZipDir" ...) - if this parameter is true, "MyDir" is created in "ZipDir" and all files and dirs within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir/MyDir"; otherwise false, "MyDir" is not created in "ZipDir", only files and subdirectories within "MyDir" are copied to "ZipDir".

The list of files and directories to download, or null to transfer files in the that match the search condition specified in the parameter. This list can contain and objects. (e.g. DownloadFiles("", false, new string[] {"file1", "file2", "dir1" }...) or DownloadFiles("", false, new object[] {"file1", fileInfo1, fileInfo2 }...))
The path of the local directory to receive files from the server.
The transfer options object which provides many settings to control the file transfer process.
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.DownloadFilesAsync(System.String,System.String,ComponentPro.IO.SearchCondition,ComponentPro.ExtendedAsyncCompletedEventHandler{ComponentPro.IO.FileSystemTransferStatistics},System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously downloads files in the specified remote directory that match the specified search condition to the local directory.
member.param: The path and name of the remote directory where the files will be downloaded to the local folder. This parameter can include filtering masks to limit the files that are downloaded. For example, if String.Empty is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be downloaded. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be downloaded. If "/mydir/*.dat;*.cs,*.vb" is used (masks are delimited by ',', ';', and '|' characters), files with the DAT, CS, and VB extensions in "/mydir" will be downloaded. If no masks specified, the whole content of the remote directory should be downloaded. The final search condition is a combination of the masks, if found, in the and the parameters. If this value ends with '>', the containing directory will also be downloaded. For example, if "/folder>" is used, files and subdirectories of "/folder" directory and itself will be downloaded; the destination directory will contain "folder" directory and its contents. Attention: some servers may be case-sensitive!
The path of the local directory to receive files from the server.
The search conditions to match against the files. (null for searching all files).
An optional asynchronous callback to be invoked when this operation completes. This parameter can be null.
A user-provided object that identifies this particular asynchronous operation.
member.returns: An asynchronous reference to a object that contains transfer statictics and a list of processed files and directories.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.SetCurrentDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the current working directory on the server.
member.param: Path of the directory to change to.

remarks.p: Both relative and absolute paths can be provided to the method to change the SFTP server's current working folder. The SFTP server's current working folder is used by the SFTP server as the base folder from which to perform file operations such as obtaining folder contents, receiving, sending and deleting files, changing the current folder, etc.
The current working folder can be retrieved via the method.

member.exception: is null reference (Nothing in VB.NET).
contains illegal path characters.
An error occurred while changing the current working directory on the server.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.CreateDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a directory on the SFTP server.
member.param: The absolute or relative (to ) path of the directory to be created.
member.returns: A string containing the absolute path of the newly created remote directory.

remarks.p: If relative path is provided, the directory will be created in the current working directory. If you want to create the directory in another location, you could specify the absolute path or use the method to change the current working directory. The current working directory can be retrieved via the method.

member.exception: is null reference (Nothing in VB.NET).
is empty or contains illegal path characters.
error occurred while create the directory on the server.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.AsciiFileSearchConditions
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of ASCII search conditions.
member.remarks: When this property is not null the component automatically uses ASCII transfer type for the files with names that match one of the ASCII file search conditions as ASCII files.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.ReconnectionMaxRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of retries for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 0 (the library does not try to reconnect to the server when the connection is lost). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed this value, the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.ReconnectionFailureDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds between failed login attempts for reconnection.
member.remarks: By default this value is 5000 (5 secs). When the connection is lost, the component will try to reconnect to the server. If the number of retries exceed the , the class will report the connection error.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.PathNormalization
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether to normalize path before any file or directory operation. Default value is true.
member.remarks: Set this to false if an operation fails due to the invalid normalized path or file path should be sent to the server as-is without adding the current directory to the beginning of the file path.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.ReconnectionErrorChecking
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server.
member.remarks: This event is fired when the file system has encountered an error and need to determine whether the it should reconnect to the server or the method is called.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.Reconnecting
member.summary: Occurs when the file system has encountered an error and trying to reconnect to the server.

member.name: E:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.Reconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the file system encountered an error and reconnected to the server.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.EncounteredFatalError
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether the client object has encountered a fatal error.
member.value: true if the client has tried and failed to reconnect to the server with the number of retries specified in ; otherwise false.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses.
member.value: The Encoding to use to encode and decode command parameters and server responses. Default is Encoding.Default.
member.remarks: Even though the RFC implies that UTF-8 is to be used to encode all communication, the practice is very different, unfortunately. In the real world, all SFTP servers seem to default to the OS default charset.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.TransferType

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.MaxDownloadSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed download speed, in kilobytes. For unlimited speed, set this to zero.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.MaxUploadSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed upload speed, in kilobytes. For unlimited speed, set this to zero.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, in milliseconds, indicating after what period of time an SFTP operation (sending commands, waiting for responses or time between data buffer transfers) should timeout. Specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to 60000 (60 seconds). Minimal value is 1000. A value of -1 or 0 indicates that the request does not timeout.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets the SFTP protocol version used by this session. This information is only available on fully initialized and authenticated sessions.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the object.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.LocalEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the local client .
member.value: The that the component is using for communications.
member.remarks: The property gets an that contains the local IP address and port number to which your Socket is bound. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the property to retrieve the local , and the property to retrieve the local port number.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.Sftp.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the remote server .
member.value: The with which the Socket is communicating.
member.remarks: If you are using a connection-oriented protocol, the property gets the that contains the remote IP address and port number to which the Socket is connected. If you are using a connectionless protocol, RemoteEndPoint contains the default remote IP address and port number with which the Socket will communicate. You must cast this to an before retrieving any information. You can then call the property to retrieve the remote , and the property to retrieve the remote port number.

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus
member.summary: Defines status codes for the class.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.ConnectionFailed
member.summary: The remote service point could not be contacted at the transport level.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: The connection was prematurely closed.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.SocketError
member.summary: The error at transport level occurred.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.UnknownHost
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the host name.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: The response received from the server was complete but indicated a protocol-level error. For example, an SCP protocol error 'File not found' would use this status.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.UnknownProxyHost
member.summary: The name resolver service could not resolve the proxy host name.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: An unclassifiable error occurred. This is the default value for .

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.ServerProtocolViolation
member.summary: The server response was not a valid SFTP response.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.Timeout
member.summary: No response was received during the time-out period for a request.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.AsyncError
member.summary: General exception in asynchronous call.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.ScpExceptionStatus.OperationFailure
member.summary: The requested operation could not be completed.
